channel.title: 2 question's...1 for javascript, other for somethin else :P
channel.description:
ok well im trying to make a website im making full screen, so i am using this code:(IE only btw)
[code]<SCRIPT LANGUAGE="JavaScript">
if (this.name!='fullscreen'){ window.open(location.href,'fullscreen','fullscreen') } // End --> </script>[/code]
only problem with it is that it has scroll bars in it and i was wondering if i could get rid of them.
#2.) is there anyway in HTML or JavaScript to open a page at the exat place you want to to go to.
for example, say on this site all you want to see when you open it is the middle or something is that possible?
or like on runescape the number of people could you have a small window with that inside it when you open it?
thanks! :)

item.title: 2 question's...1 for javascript, other for somethin else :P
item.dc:creator: @itendsnow itendsnow
item.description:
@itendsnow wrote:

You can use css to set no overflow on the page.

Read full topic
item.source: 2 question's...1 for javascript, other for somethin else :P

item.title: 2 question's...1 for javascript, other for somethin else :P
item.dc:creator: @vortex vortex
item.description:
@vortex wrote:

Get your needs off of this script I got from dynamicdrive

function modelesswin(url,mwidth,mheight){
if (document.all&&window.print) //if ie5
eval('window.showModelessDialog(url,"","help:0;resizable:1;dialogWidth:'+mwidth+'px;dialogHeight:'+mheight+'px")')
else
eval('window.open(url,"","width='+mwidth+'px,height='+mheight+'px,resizable=1,scrollbars=0")')
}

Read full topic
item.source: 2 question's...1 for javascript, other for somethin else :P

item.title: 2 question's...1 for javascript, other for somethin else :P
item.dc:creator: @ioklio ioklio
item.description:
@ioklio wrote:

ok well im trying to make a website im making full screen, so i am using this code:(IE only btw)

<SCRIPT LANGUAGE="JavaScript">
if (this.name!='fullscreen'){ 
  window.open(location.href,'fullscreen','fullscreen') 
} 
//  End -->
</script>

only problem with it is that it has scroll bars in it and i was wondering if i could get rid of them.

2.) is there anyway in HTML or JavaScript to open a page at the exat place you want to to go to.

for example, say on this site all you want to see when you open it is the middle or something is that possible?

or like on runescape the number of people could you have a small window with that inside it when you open it?

thanks!
